oai_dc:dc.dc:title: List of East Tennessee and Kentucky prisoners held at Tusculum College
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The list of prisoners, written on a form from Tusculum College dated August 1861, contains 126 names of Union sympathizers and, possibly, bridge burners. For many of the names, there is also a county listed. Included among the prisoners were Edmund and William Hodges, of Sevier Co., Tenn. who burned the bridge in Strawberry Plains, Tenn. The prisoners were later transferred to Tuscaloosa, Ala.
